author: protolambda
content: Warning: I'm moving a ton of validators and updating nodes, should be a temporary 10% decrease in testnet participation, two times over the next hour or two.

author: protolambda
content: Probably hitting 75%, all good though, taking my time

author: ajsutton
content: ooo 69%.  I guess I wait to deploy my latest experiment to a few nodes... ðŸ™‚

author: protolambda
content: I'm putting back the old nodes online, hit a problem with new deployment

author: ajsutton
content: I don't think its an issue.  A bit of non-finalization is good for us every now and then (on a testnet at least).

author: protolambda
content: The validators were using the old mnemonic derivation, and I think I either used the new one, or maybe the wrong one. Either way, deployed the wrong validators. Old nodes are coming back up now, no problem

author: protolambda
content: Oh well, checking keystore generation to see what happened to the validator deployments, and will retry after the net is healthy and ready again (and 10% at a time, if I am more careful about node selection)

author: protolambda
content: Fixed the keystore problem, correct mnemonic is used now, redeploying 10% slowly

author: protolambda
content: FYI: EF validators redistributed: validator keys don't match old client type anymore, still a 1/4 split between all though. Beaconchain tags will be updated later. Block graffiti is always up to date, if you need data for analysis. Sorry for the inconvenience, we had to make some changes to the our infra.

author: protolambda
content: EF nodes running well now, but resolving a new issue where Prysm validators started timing out on GRPC to beacons. Should be back up from 85% to 90% network performance later today

author: protolambda
content: Update: we're hovering around 84% on Pyrmont now: there is some issue with our Prysm nodes we are investigating, and validators of the Prylabs team are also partially offline.
